I might as well get in on these discussions.


On Mon, 8 Jul 2002, dph_of_rules wrote:

> The topic for this week is . . .
> the advantages and disadvantages of single player teams.
>
> What are the advantages and disadvantages of single player teams?

What do you mean by single player teams? One human person, or one
character on the team? If its one human person, then the disadvantage is
obviously that the rest of your team are getting themselves killed
constanty.

If its one character on a team, then the advantage is that you can invest
your money into making him/her better. However, you obviously can't use
team tactics (ie, a druid stays back and builds a base while a thief
cloaks and does hit-and-runs on enemy generators).


- Zardus
